meanings.definition: Denoting a concept or commentary on itself, often used in the context of art or literature.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a meta scene where the characters talked about being in a movie.
meanings.sent2: The artist's meta painting referenced famous artworks in a clever way.
meanings.sent3: It was quite meta when the book characters realized they were just characters in a story.
meanings.sent4: Her play was so meta, it felt like a play within a play within a play.
meanings.sent5: The meta nature of the poem made it stand out among other poems.

meanings.sent1: The comedian's meta jokes often broke the fourth wall.
meanings.sent2: The film's meta humor made the audience feel included in the jokes.
meanings.sent3: It was meta how the character knew they were in a TV show.
meanings.sent4: His self-referential humor was so meta, it left everyone laughing.
meanings.sent5: The meta character in the story was always aware of the audience watching.

meanings.sent1: The concept of time travel in the movie was truly meta.
meanings.sent2: The artist's work was so meta, it seemed to exist in another realm.
meanings.sent3: It felt meta when the protagonist's choices went beyond the usual limits.
meanings.sent4: The music was so meta, it transported the listeners to a different dimension.
meanings.sent5: The meta ending of the story left the readers contemplating its deeper meaning.
